item.title: 瑞典储蓄银行（SBB）与卡斯尔莱克（Castlelake）成立另一家合资企业以解决债务问题
item.description: 瑞典储蓄银行周六表示，它正在与美国私人信贷公司 Castlelake 成立一家合资企业，这是它在大约三个月内成立的第二家合资企业，将有助于缓解这家瑞典房地产集团的债务困境。【原文：SBB said on Saturday it is forming a joint venture with U.S.-based private credit firm Castlelake, its second in about three months, which will help ease the Swedish real estate group's debt woes.】

item.title: 加拿大以国家安全为由下令解散两家公司
item.description: 加拿大周五以国家安全为由，下令解散两家科技公司在该国的业务。【原文：Canada ordered on Friday the dissolution of two technology companies' businesses in the country, citing national security concerns.】

item.title: 美国贸易代表办公室延长部分对华关税排除期限，但许多关税排除期限将被取消
item.description: 美国贸易代表办公室（USTR）周五宣布，将352项中国进口商品和77项与大流行病相关的类别的所有中国301条款关税排除期限进一步延长至6月14日，并表示其中一些类别的关税排除期限将延长至2025年5月31日。【原文：The U.S. Trade Representative's (USTR) office on Friday announced a further extension of all China Section 301 tariff exclusions on 352 Chinese import and 77 pandemic-related categories through June 14, and said some would be extended through May 31, 2025.】

item.title: 乌瓦尔德学校枪击案受害者家属起诉美达公司、微软公司和枪支制造商
item.description: 2022 年德克萨斯州乌瓦尔德小学枪击案的受害者家属周五对 Instagram 的母公司 Meta、动视暴雪及其母公司微软以及枪支制造商丹尼尔防务公司提起了两起诉讼，声称他们合作向乌瓦尔德枪手等易受影响的青少年推销危险武器。【原文：Families of the victims of the 2022 elementary school shooting in Uvalde, Texas, filed two lawsuits on Friday against Instagram's parent company Meta , Activision Blizzard and its parent Microsoft and the gunmaker Daniel Defense, claiming they cooperated to market dangerous weapons to impressionable teens such as the Uvalde shooter.】

item.title: GameStop 完成场内股票出售后股价大涨
item.description: GameStop 周五表示，它在一项场内股票出售计划中出售了多达 4500 万股股票，总收益约为 9.334 亿美元，使其股价在延时交易中上涨了近 18%。【原文：GameStop said on Friday it sold up to 45 million shares in an at-the-market share sale program for an aggregate gross proceeds of about $933.4 million, sending its shares up nearly 18% in extended trading.】

item.title: UAW 要求美国董事会对梅赛德斯阿拉巴马州工厂的工会组织进行新一轮投票
item.description: 美国汽车工人联合会（UAW）上周在阿拉巴马州一家梅赛德斯-奔驰（Mercedes-Benz）工厂的投票中败北，据该工会周五向全国劳资关系委员会（National Labor Relations Board）提交的一份请愿书显示，该工会正寻求在该工厂举行一次新的选举。【原文：The United Auto Workers (UAW) union is seeking a new election at a Mercedes-Benz plant in Alabama after losing a vote there last week, according to a petition filed on Friday with the National Labor Relations Board.】

item.title: 美国无党派政治人士逐渐接近共和党人对经济的悲观看法
item.description: 在一项备受关注的消费者对经济的总体态度月度调查中，美国政治独立人士通常占据中间位置，但今年他们的观点却逐渐接近共和党人的沉闷观点，这对希望在11月5日总统大选中守住白宫的民主党人来说是一个潜在的警示信号。【原文：U.S. political independents, who typically occupy the center ground in a closely watched monthly survey of overall consumer attitudes about the economy, have drifted closer this year to the dour views held by Republicans, a potential warning sign for Democrats hoping to hold onto the White House in the Nov. 5 presidential election.】

item.title: 人工智能股票大涨，戴尔创历史新高
item.description: 周五，在对新技术的强烈乐观情绪推动下，研究生成式人工智能应用的公司纷纷大涨，戴尔科技公司的股价也创下历史新高。【原文：Shares of Dell Technologies hit a record high on Friday amid a rally in companies working on generative artificial intelligence applications, buoyed by strong optimism for the new technology.】

item.title: CMA 称，Meta 提交了英国隐私合规提案的修改意见
item.description: 作为竞争市场管理局（CMA）11月接受的建议修正案的一部分，Meta Platforms提出限制使用其Facebook Marketplace平台上所有广告商的某些数据。【原文：Meta Platforms has offered to limit the use of certain data from all advertisers on its Facebook Marketplace platform, as part of amendments to the proposals accepted by the Competition Market Authority (CMA) in November, the regulator said on Friday.】

item.title: 航空公司、酒店和零售商担心被排除在谷歌搜索变革之外
item.description: 代表航空公司、酒店和零售商的游说团体敦促欧盟技术监管机构确保谷歌在做出改变以遵守具有里程碑意义的技术规则时，考虑到他们的意见，而不仅仅是大型中介机构的意见。【原文：Lobbying groups representing airlines, hotels and retailers have urged European Union tech regulators to ensure that Google takes their views into account, and not just large intermediaries, when making changes to comply with landmark tech rules.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，瑞士宝盛正在考虑收购瑞士竞争对手 EFG
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五援引知情人士的话报道，瑞士私人银行集团瑞士宝盛正在探讨收购竞争对手 EFG International 的可能性。【原文：Switzerland's private banking group Julius Baer is exploring a potential acquisition of rival EFG International , Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 巴西航空公司披露代码共享协议，Azul 和 Gol 股价大涨
item.description: 巴西 Azul 航空公司和 Gol 航空公司周五宣布达成代码共享协议，将两家公司的网络和飞行常客计划连接起来，此举再次引发了有关潜在合并的猜测，两家公司股价随之飙升。【原文：Shares in Brazilian airlines Azul and Gol soared on Friday after they announced a codeshare agreement, connecting their networks and frequent flyer programs in a move that reignited speculation about a potential merger.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 通胀数据和总统辩论可能导致夏季涨势受挫
item.description: 今年夏天，美国股市的典型放缓趋势可能会更加明显，通胀忧虑和提前举行的总统大选辩论有可能对近几个月来推动 S&P 500 指数接近历史高点的反弹造成压力。【原文：The typical summer slowdown in U.S. stock markets may be more pronounced this year with inflation jitters and an early presidential debate that have the potential to weigh on a rally that has pushed the S&P 500 near record highs in recent months.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称，沙特阿拉伯计划最快于 6 月出售阿美石油公司股票
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的人士称，沙特阿拉伯正计划最快于 6 月出售能源巨头阿美石油公司（Aramco）价值数十亿美元的股票，这将是该地区最大的股票交易之一。【原文：Saudi Arabia is planning a multi-billion-dollar share sale in energy giant Aramco as soon as June in what would be one of the region's biggest stock deals, two people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: Live Nation 票务购买者在美国司法部案件后提起诉讼
item.description: 在美国政府和各州周四起诉拆散 Live Nation 及其 Ticketmaster 分部之后，这两家公司可能又将遭遇新一轮消费者反垄断诉讼。【原文：Live Nation and its Ticketmaster unit have been hit with the first in a likely wave of new consumer antitrust lawsuits after the U.S. government and states sued to break up the two companies on Thursday.】

item.title: 道达尔能源公司老板连任董事会成员，获得约 76% 的股东投票通过
item.description: 根据道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies）年度股东大会的投票结果，法国石油巨头道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies）董事长兼首席执行官帕特里克-普瓦纳（Patrick Pouyanne）以约 76% 的股东票数再次被任命为公司董事会成员。【原文：Patrick Pouyanne, chairman and chief executive of French oil major TotalEnergies , was re-appointed to the company's board by around 76 percent of shareholder votes, according to the result of a vote at TotalEnergies' annual general meeting.】

item.title: 什么是欧佩克+，它对油价有何影响？
item.description: 石油输出国组织（欧佩克）和包括俄罗斯在内的盟国被统称为 "欧佩克+"，将于 6 月 2 日举行会议，讨论联合石油生产政策。【原文：The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) and allies including Russia are known collectively as OPEC+ and will meet on June 2 to discuss their joint oil production policy.】

item.title: 独家报道墨西哥阿萨尔科集团将在价格飙升之际重开美国铜冶炼厂
item.description: 两位直接了解该公司计划的消息人士告诉路透社，墨西哥工业集团（Grupo Mexico）控制的矿业公司阿萨尔科（Asarco）正计划重启其在美国的停产铜冶炼厂，因为这种红色金属的价格创下了历史新高。【原文：Asarco, the mining company controlled by industrial conglomerate Grupo Mexico , is planning to restart its mothballed copper smelter in the United States as prices for the red metal hit record highs, two sources with direct knowledge of the company's plans told Reuters.】

item.title: 联邦快递在乌克兰暂停服务两年后恢复服务
item.description: 包裹递送公司联邦快递公司（FedEx Corp）周五表示，已恢复在乌克兰的国际优先进出港服务。【原文：Parcel delivery firm FedEx Corp said on Friday that it has reinstated international priority inbound and outbound services in Ukraine.】

item.title: 道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies）表示正在研究在美国交叉上市的问题。
item.description: 道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies）周五表示，该公司正在研究将其股票在美国交叉上市的计划，同时也在泛欧交易所保留其股票。【原文：TotalEnergies said on Friday that it is studying plans to cross-list its shares in the United States, while also keeping its shares on the Euronext stock exchange.】

item.title: 肥胖症药物需求激增，礼来再投资 53 亿美元新建印第安纳州生产基地
item.description: 礼来公司（Eli Lilly）周五表示，该公司已向印第安纳州黎巴嫩的新生产厂再投资 53 亿美元，是之前投资额的两倍多，因为该公司正努力满足对其减肥药和糖尿病药物不断飙升的需求。【原文：Eli Lilly said on Friday it has invested another $5.3 billion in its new Lebanon, Indiana manufacturing plant, more than doubling its previous investment, as it scrambles to meet soaring demand for its weight-loss and diabetes drugs.】

item.title: 美国对 Waymo 自动驾驶汽车的安全调查发现更多事故
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周五表示，它又获悉了九起事故，这些事故引起了人们对 Alphabet 旗下 Waymo 自动驾驶汽车性能的担忧。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said Friday it has learned of nine additional incidents that raise concerns about the performance of Alphabet's Waymo self-driving vehicles.】

item.title: 沃尔玛与 Capital One 终止信用卡协议
item.description: 沃尔玛（Walmart）与美国第一资本金融公司（Capital One Financial）周五表示，沃尔玛已终止与该公司的协议，后者曾是沃尔玛消费信用卡的独家发行商。【原文：Walmart has ended its agreement with Capital One Financial , which was the exclusive issuer of Walmart consumer credit cards, the companies said on Friday.】

item.title: 美联储主席沃勒指出未来基本利率可能上升的原因
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）周五表示，在经过多年的下降之后，关键的基本利率有可能在未来上升，但现在说是否会发生还为时过早。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said on Friday it's possible that a key underlying interest rate may rise in the future after years of declines, but it's too soon to say if that will happen.】

item.title: 美国 4 月份核心资本货物订单和发货量反弹
item.description: 4 月份美国主要制成品资本货物的新订单反弹幅度超过预期，这些货物的出货量也有所增加，这表明企业在第二季度初的设备支出有所回升。【原文：New orders for key U.S.-manufactured capital goods rebounded more than expected in April and shipments of these goods also increased, suggesting a pick up in business spending on equipment early in the second quarter.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司批准尚布里亚特出任新首席执行官
item.description: 巴西国营石油公司（Petrobras）称，其董事会周五批准了玛格达-尚布里亚（Magda Chambriard）担任公司新任首席执行官的提名。【原文：Brazilian state-run oil firm Petrobras said its board of directors on Friday approved the nomination of Magda Chambriard as the company's new Chief Executive.】

item.title: 受降息预期影响，美国股票基金每周大量流入
item.description: 在截至5月22日的一周里，美国股票基金获得了大量资金流入，这主要是受到美国联邦储备委员会因通胀放缓迹象而可能降息的预期，以及企业盈利强劲增长带来的乐观情绪的推动。【原文：U.S. equity funds secured substantial inflows in the week ended May 22, buoyed by expectations that the U.S. Federal Reserve might cut interest rates due to signs of slowing inflation, alongside optimism from robust corporate earnings growth.】

item.title: 波音公司员工对产品安全和质量的担忧增加了六倍
item.description: 波音公司周五表示，在 2024 年的前两个月里，该公司员工提出的与产品和服务安全有关的问题比去年同期增加了六倍。【原文：Boeing saw a six-fold increase in submissions from its employees raising concerns related to the safety of products and services during the first two months of 2024, compared with the same period last year, the planemaker said on Friday.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，一些大银行要求更多员工每周五天返回办公室工作
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四晚些时候报道，花旗集团、汇丰控股和巴克莱银行正在命令更多员工每周五天到公司办公室报到。【原文：Citigroup , HSBC Holdings and Barclays are ordering more staffers to report to company offices five days a week, Bloomberg News reported late on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国众议院委员会推进农业法案草案，民主党人支持率不高
item.description: 共和党领导的美国众议院农业委员会于周四深夜通过了其版本的 1.5 万亿美元农业支出法案，但民主党的投票却寥寥无几，延长了两党在关键的营养、农业和气候政策上的僵持。【原文：The Republican-led U.S. House of Representatives Agriculture Committee passed its version of a $1.5 trillion farm spending bill late Thursday night with few Democratic votes, prolonging a standoff between the parties over key nutrition, agriculture, and climate policies.】
